newsitem.title: USA: CME March lumber drops $10 limit in late trading.
newsitem.headline: CME March lumber drops $10 limit in late trading.

text.p: CME March lumber futures fell the $10.00 per tbf daily limit in late trading pressured by local selling linked to sentiment that cash market activity will remain light, traders said.
"We came into the year with a lot of optimism and no business and the no business finally caught up with the optimism," said Curt Cunningham, president of Pacific Futures.
Cunningham said lumber mills sold the market last week and early this week, which was an indication cash markets may remain under pressure.
At 1303 CST, March lumber closed down the $10.00 limit at $412.80 per tbf. January lumber closed down $6.60 at $412.40.
